item.title: Deportation Programs Negatively Affect Latino Segregation.
item.description: Using a quasi-experimental design comparing 287(g) and non-implementing counties, this paper shows that local immigration enforcement slowed declines in Latino-white segregation, especially in early-adopting Southern counties.

item.title: Immigrants in Japan are pretty segregated.
item.description: Using census microdata, this paper describes the trends of majority-minorty and minority-minority segregation and their associations with segregation theories in Japan from 2000 to 2020.

item.title: Chinese immigrants move back to Chinatowns for coethnic preferences.
item.description: Using sequence analysis, this paper finds that residential mobility into and out of ethnic neighborhoods is associated with varying levels of socioeconomic resources and coethnic preferences.

item.title: Locally educated immigrant labor does not necessarily earn more in Japan.
item.description: This paper shows that for immigrant labor, education in Japan does not lead to higher income levels after adjusting for various confounders, including university rankings and majors.
